overview: This seminar will explore the aesthetics of popular material culture in the everyday. A diverse range of topics, theories, and bodies of work in the field will be introduced and discussed. Students will develop an appreciation of popular or everyday art, architecture and design, and also gain an understanding of how these things may inform their own design work.

At the conclusion of this subject students will develop an appreciation of popular or everyday art, architecture and design, and also gain an understanding of how these things may inform their own design work.
ilo: an appreciation of popular or everyday art,
also gain an understanding of how these things may inform their own design work.
generic_skills: Identify key theories and issues in the field of popular material culture;
Engage in critical debate about the use of vernacular form;
Utilise an understanding of everyday aesthetics in design work.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Written and graphic assignments - one individual project of up to 1000
One group project of up to 2000 words
One essay of at least 3000 words
